Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: We were charged $69.95 but $78.77 is what came out of my account when I called to inquire why I was told that was before tax we signed a piece of paper for $69.95 to come out of our account not $ 78.77 we could have booked the room at hot wire for $45.00 which is about all this place is worth my non-smoking room was right next to the employees room where apparently they smoke because we had to leave our room as soon as they arrived at work due to the stench! Folks Branson has much better Motels and better staff. I will be taking this up with my Bank... This is not about the money it is the principal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Maccantoo
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of the hotel. Just off the strip enough that it was no problem getting in or out of the parking lot at any time of day or evening. The staff was very friendly, especially the lady that kept up the dining room area during breakfast. The pool as very nice and was cleaned every morning before 8am. We left our room later than most each morning and each evening when we returned our trash had been emptied and fresh towels had been left, which I thought was nice because I know the housekeeper had already cleaned most every room on in area before we even removed our "Do Not Distrub" sign. My only complaints would be that there were stains on the carpet in our room but I do understand they are cleaning all the carpets in the hotel this month. I was not impresses with the breakfast...but it is complimentary and the area is kept up very well. My husband enjoyed just fine...i am just a picky eater, but I did enjoy the bagel that I had, I would have really enjoyed a waffle maker or something like that. Being former "pageant people" that are used to traveling and staying in types of hotels, I would say this one is GREAT for the price we paid. Overall we had a VERY pleasant stay here and would consider this location the next time we are in Branson. (which we plan to make a trip there at least a couple of times per year)

Reviews.Title: “commendation to breakfast host”
Reviews.Author: patty k
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the motel for 6 consecutive nights in late August, 2012. Nice and quiet place. We enjoyed their tasty breakfast each morning and want to commend the breakfast host who happily greeted everyone entering the dining room while keeping the tables and counter tops spotless at all times and making sure the food was always in a neat and presentable manner. Not the same on her days off though. Think her name is Lana. Give her a pat on the back for a job well done. We are from Minnesota and stay at this motel each time we're in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “aweful”
Reviews.Author: Lisa A
Reviews.Content: i hate staying there will neaver stay there again most of the house keeping i got could not even speak englist and my meds that where in my room on the counter where gone when i got back to the room i would neaver tell anyone about this place dont stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: teddies1999
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and friendly helped with shows and driving directions requested room near enterance due to have a brace on knee and ankle was told none available I was given a room far away on back of building parking was hard as it was on a hill breakfast was good pool noise were load inside room air conditioner was loud had to use earplugs

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scoobym0m
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after a really bad experience at our first choice hotel, after checking out of the other hotel we went for dinner and booked this place while we were eating dinner. Turned out to be an excellent choice. All the staff were great and super friendly. The rooms were very clean, smelled nice, and came equipped with a fridge. Very important feature when you travel with kids. The pool was nice and clean too. The breakfast room attendant on our last morning was so nice and so friendly, we are so glad we got the chance to meet her. Just a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Southern country Ghettotel of Branson”
Reviews.Author: Cjmiami
Reviews.Content: The floor was filthy and the role out bed they brought us still had the previous guest food and stains inside folded up. The A/C growled and clanked all night long. The sink would not drain properly. And the GM wasn't willing to do anything but tell me I should have called at 11:30 pm with 3 tired kids and they would have changed the A/C out. Sorry but have your rooms ready and spend some money on the Ghettotel before people check in.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: AR-BRAY
Reviews.Content: off the strip but very close. Great staff. Great service. The hotel is older so there may be some things needing attention but if you call the front desk they willnsend something within 5 minutes. Breakfast is good. Pool is clean.

Reviews.Title: “They do not care and floors are very dirty”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: This property allows pets. I love dogs. BUT not one that barks 24/7. This poor dog was not happy!! I could not sleep with the noise of barking. I requested a refund for the night I could not sleep and the night I DID NOT stay. They refused both nights refund. They offered me a different room on the floor with ALL the dogs! And offered me a room at an inferior hotel. BUT no refund and no offer to help move our luggage. No dogs were allowed on the floor I was on, but this poor dog was 2 doors down. The manager refused to make the dog owners move off the floor. I moved our luggage to the car and we headed home. If you stay, be sure to take shoes to wear while in the room and bathroom. The carpet and bathroom floor is very dirty. The breakfast is OK but the 4" plate they give you to eat on is a JOKE.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMSims
Reviews.Content: Southern Comfort Inn was a very nice hotel to stay at. Economical, clean, and friendly. Just a mile from the main strip which gives you some peace and quite from all the rush. A family place with all the comforts of home, microwave, fridge......

Reviews.Title: “Old but very clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: jessido
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Branson, my mom and I walked in asked to see a room and checked in. The room we were assigned was a double Queen overlooking the pool and on the same level as the front parking lot/lobby, perfect for my elderly grandpa. I smelled clean room as soon as I walked in, the bathroom was tiny but clean, the carpet looked recently vaccumed and the a/c was working. The beds were comfortable with the mattress toppers but I could tell it's time for new mattresses. The linens were fresh and comfortable, not soft but not rough either, just fine. The flat screen tv worked ok, some issues with the remote but nothing too bad, prob just faulty batteries, there was a blow dryer in the room we didn't use, do bring toilettries because a soap, a hair conditioner and a shower cap were given only. there was a coffee machine but didn't use it. The hot breakfast was great, everything looked clean and was tasty, I liked that e/a slice of bread came in its own sandwich bag so I knew nobody had manhandled my slice of toast. There were three kind of juice, good yogurt, biscuits and gravy, sc eggs and sausages. Overall a great stay i would def. go back, the only reason I didn't book in advance was because I had a horrible experience at the Ramada Inn so I wanted to check the room before checking in. The staff was excellent, very helpful when it came to directions, advise on where to eat, etc. The only bad thing if I can even call it that, is that the parking is a bit restricted with a limited number of spots up front and the location is not within walking distance of strip but with Branson traffic I call that a Major positive Big plus!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: corvettefan
Reviews.Content: Previously a Ramada Inn which has been cleaned up somewhat. For as little as we paid we felt we got more than our money's worth. We had a 2 Queen Bed Room and I appreciate having a long sink and counter area "outside" the toilet/shower room so both of us can be getting ready at the same time. All the rooms are accessed from outside walkways and it had a free breakfast consisting of sausage patties, bisquits, gravy, toast, donuts, prepared egg patties; fruit, some dry cereal, etc. The front desk is extremely friendly and helpful and the motel is located in a "quiet area" away from the busy Hwy. 76 area.

HotelInfo.Name: Southern Country Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2316 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Ramada Limited Branson)
